Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Build retro 1980s calculator app for checkbook balancing

This commit implements a complete React Native Expo calculator app designed
for older users to balance their checkbooks. The app features a retro 1980s
aesthetic inspired by Canon palm printer calculators.

Features:
- Large 70x70px buttons for easy tapping
- LCD display with amber/green color options
- Checkbook mode (rounds to 2 decimals for cents)
- Scientific mode (supports up to 8 decimals)
- Undo/Redo system with 5-second visual feedback
- Receipt tape history with scrollable entries
- Persistent storage with AsyncStorage
- Auto-cleanup of history (30/60/90 day retention)
- Plain English error messages for user-friendly experience
- 5-second timeouts for all messages (accessibility for older users)
- Mode switch warnings explaining decimal precision
- Settings modal for customization

Components:
- Display: LCD-style display with high contrast
- Button: Retro 3D buttons with raised/pressed effects
- ButtonGrid: Responsive button layout for checkbook operations
- ReceiptTape: Scrollable history with thermal paper aesthetic
- ErrorModal: User-friendly error messages
- UndoRedoIndicator: Visual feedback for undo/redo operations
- ModeSwitch: Informational modal for mode transitions
- SettingsModal: Comprehensive settings interface

Business Logic:
- useCalculator: State management for calculator operations
- useUndoRedo: Maintains 20-state history for undo/redo
- useSounds: Audio effects integration (placeholder for MP3s)
- CalculatorEngine: Math operations with error handling
- Storage utilities: AsyncStorage integration with persistence
- Date formatter: Human-readable timestamps

Configuration:
- Android API 21+ support
- iOS 11+ support
- TypeScript strict mode
- Zero TypeScript errors
